answers.answer: This does beg the question of why with such a worrying response to alchohol you are drinking at all?!  If you cannot help but drink, then you have to admit to having an alcholol problem, if not then just stop.  It's the equivalent of banging your head repeatedly against a brick wall and then complaining you have a headache.  This is obviously harming you so the answer is seemingly straightforward.  Yes there could be a connection to your diabetes, achohol is filled with sugar and is a diuretic, and also likely is reacting to your medication.  One other less likely explanation is an extreme wheat allergy, if you are drinking beer, but given your medical history I wouldn't delve into this theory just yet.  Please stop drinking alchohol, this problem is very easy to solve.  If you can't stop drinking, please get help so you can overcome this.  You have diabetes insipidus, you are at constant risk of dehydration.  Your medication is working to counteract this.  Alchohol is a diuretic (makes you pee lots and lose lots of water).  Surely you can see what a bad combination this is.  Take the sacrifice and stick to soft drinks when you go out.  Sorry for the harsh response, just annoys me that you are making yourself sicker than you need to be by your actions.  Be well.
